meanings.definition: To make (attitudes or behavior) part of one's nature by learning or unconscious assimilation.
meanings.sent1: She internalized the importance of kindness from her parents.
meanings.sent2: He internalized the lesson about honesty after being caught in a lie.
meanings.sent3: The cat internalized the idea that the vacuum cleaner was a monster.
meanings.sent4: The student internalized the teacher's words, letting them guide his actions.
meanings.sent5: The melody was internalized in her mind, playing on repeat.

meanings.definition: To incorporate (something, typically a cultural value) as part of one's own character.
meanings.sent1: They internalized the tradition of celebrating Lunar New Year every year.
meanings.sent2: She internalized the belief in hard work from her immigrant parents.
meanings.sent3: The dog internalized the idea that fetch was the best game ever.
meanings.sent4: The artist internalized the beauty of nature, reflecting it in their paintings.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh bread baking was internalized in his memory, bringing comfort.
